image.altText: A burnt out fire place.

props.synopsis: More than five years after being destroyed by the Black Summer bushfires, two heritage huts in the ACT's Namadgi National Park remain burnt-out, fenced-off ruins, despite government promises to build two new structures in remembrance of them.

title.children: 'A complete wreck': Heritage huts remain in ruins after Black Summer fires

image.altText: A woman in a pink sweater and black vest.

props.synopsis: Christine Yerbury has been waiting since October to receive an occupational therapy assessment to allow her to receive a Deaf-appropriate device.

title.children: 'It's just not safe for me': Christine is Deaf and needs a new home

image.altText: Three women standing beside a medical bed with a fake person in it.

props.synopsis: Canberra Health System has reported an increase in the number of occupational violence incidents. But it's not all bad news.

title.children: The methods being used in Canberra to reduce hospital violence

image.altText: People gather at Lake Burley Griffin to dragon boat

props.synopsis: More than 300 of Australia's best paddlers have travelled to Germany to compete in next week's World Dragon Boat Racing Championships — and there are 32 Canberra-based competitors among them.

title.children: The Canberrans taking the world stage in this niche sport

image.altText: A hallway with carpet with rows of bikes.

props.synopsis: ACT Policing located the goods, estimated to be worth upwards of $50,000, in a serviced apartment.

title.children: AirTag helps uncover stolen stash of bikes and scooters in Canberra

image.altText: A woman in a green blouse with blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Police say a man was shot in the leg after two men in hoodies allegedly invaded his house during the night.

title.children: Police search for alleged home invaders after man shot in leg

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera while surrounded by long grass.

props.synopsis: After a tragic loss, this rural town took the mental health of its shearing community into its own hands, and hopes to spread the message to every shed across the country.

title.children: When Mitch died at 22, his town started a shearing event to save others

image.altText: Iga Swiatek celebrates

props.synopsis: Iga Świątek has blitzed Amanda Anisimova 6-0, 6-0 in just 57 minutes to claim her first Wimbledon title.

title.children: Świątek beats Anisimova in just 57 minutes to win Wimbledon title

image.altText: Three police officers in bulletproof vests walk away from the camera through a shopping centre car park at sunset

props.synopsis: A man allegedly armed with a machete has been shot dead by police at a shopping centre in Sydney's west.

title.children: Man shot dead by police at shopping centre in Sydney's west

image.altText: A police car blocks a road where a car crash has occured.

props.synopsis: A grandfather who was struck by a car while walking along a footpath in Melbourne's east with his wife and grandson has died from his injuries.

title.children: Grandfather the second person to die after crash in Melbourne's east

image.altText: a black and white drawing of a man in sunglasses next to a colour drawing of a mans head

props.synopsis: Newly released FBI files reveal fresh details about the hunt for a man who hijacked a plane and parachuted to freedom with more than $300,000 in ransom money.

title.children: New FBI files reveal suspects, tips and hoaxes in DB Cooper cold case

image.altText: NH-90 New Zealand Helicopter bushfires

props.synopsis: A version of the Taipan helicopter that Australia’s Army permanently grounded after a deadly crash two years ago will be involved in the international military exercises where the devastating accident occurred.

title.children: Taipan-like helicopter to fly again during Talisman Sabre exercises

image.altText: A group of smiling people in a room.

props.synopsis: The listing has been welcomed by many, but some say the site already "looks like an industrial complex" and that the last-minute removal of recommended protections puts it at further risk.

title.children: Has Murujuga's World Heritage listing come too late?

image.altText: A young man in a black hooded jumper smiles and makes a shaka sign with his hands.

props.synopsis: Australia's small but vibrant Tuvaluan community is preparing for the arrival of new migrants from their home islands — including with youth events teaching their culture to the next generation.

title.children: 'We need to hold on': Tuvalu's fight for survival finds home in Australia

image.altText: A profile photo of a young woman with long dark hair and brown eyes

props.synopsis: The woman who found missing German backpacker Carolina Wilga by the side of an outback road has describes her rescue as "miraculous".

title.children: Rescuer describes moment she discovered lost German backpacker

image.altText: A crashed plane

props.synopsis: In the weeks since the deadly Air India crash, questions have swirled around exactly what happened. Finally, there are some answers.

title.children: 'Mayday, mayday, mayday': What the first Air India crash report revealed

image.altText: Camarillo tear gas

props.synopsis: US federal agents have arrested hundreds of workers during a immigration raid in the latest escalation of President Donald Trump's campaign for mass deportations.

title.children: California worker dead and hundreds arrested after cannabis farm raid

image.altText: Cropped shot of young woman carrying shopping basket, standing at produce aisle in supermarket.

props.synopsis: Despite being mentioned in medical manuscripts for hundreds of years, we still know little about what causes kleptomania or how to effectively treat the debilitating condition.

title.children: 'Stigmatised and hidden': What drives the compulsive urge to steal?

image.altText: Sarah Gigante holds up her hand

props.synopsis: Sarah Gigante has become the first Australian in 27 years to win multiple stages at the Giro d'Italia Donne, winning the queen stage to move back to third in the overall standings.

title.children: Gigante solos to victory on Giro queen stage

image.altText: Volker Turk

props.synopsis: UN rights chief Volker Turk said a coroner's inquiry into Kumanjayi Walker's death "uncovers disturbing allegations of institutional racism in Northern Territory policing and use of excessive force".

title.children: Police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker shows Australia needs 'comprehensive reform', UN says

image.altText: Sione Tuipulotu high-fives Huw Jones

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions remain unbeaten on their Australian tour, thrashing the AUNZ XV 48-0 in their last hit-out before the first Test against the Wallabies.

title.children: Lions iron out errors with dominant win a week out from first Test

image.altText: Gabi Ruffels lines up a tee shot at the Evian Championship.

props.synopsis: Australia's Gabi Ruffels will enter the final round of the Evian Championship as the co-leader, a stroke ahead of compatriots Grace Kim and Minjee Lee.

title.children: Ruffels leads Aussie charge towards more major glory at Evian Championship

image.altText: Tia Hinds passes the ball for the Wallaroos against the Black Ferns.

props.synopsis: The Wallaroos throw their best shot at the Black Ferns before succumbing 37-12 in a loss compounded by an injury to captain Siokapesi Palu.

title.children: Wallaroos feel Black Ferns' force in World Cup build-up

image.altText: A shirtless man with tattooes.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most wanted men amassed grand wealth while luring his mates into a police trap. The problem is he may never face justice down under.

title.children: One of Australia's most wanted had everything. Now he faces 262 years' jail

image.altText: Cowboys coach Todd Payten looks on to his left, listening to a question

props.synopsis: Canterbury has snapped a two-match losing run to defeat North Queensland in Townsville, without high-profile recruit Lachlan Galvin.

title.children: Coach 'losing sleep' as errors cost Cowboys dearly in loss to Bulldogs

image.altText: The original Birkin bag on top of black glass display case.

props.synopsis: Why just having enough money will not buy you one of the most exclusive accessories in the fashion world.

title.children: How luxury handbag collectors 'play the Hermès game' to secure Birkins

image.altText: A woman and a man smile as they pat sheep in a pen.

props.synopsis: A Victorian merino stud has bred its first line of footrot-resistant rams in a major step forward against a disease that costs the sheep industry more than $80 million a year.

title.children: Breeder makes breakthrough in fight against dreaded sheep disease

image.altText: a woman with short hair holding a baby of Asian descent above her head, both smiling.

props.synopsis: Ute Young was only expecting one baby from Vietnam when she raced from rural South Australia to Melbourne Airport on Christmas Eve 1973. Instead, she was handed three.

title.children: A late-night phone call, a frantic flight and a baby in need of a mum

image.altText: Erin Patterson looks at the camera as she sits in the back of a prison van

props.synopsis: As the jury revealed its verdict, a tension built over weeks of legal arguments and disputed versions of what happened the day Erin Patterson hosted her in-laws for lunch was resolved.

title.children: With four words, Erin Patterson's jury gave a community its answer

image.altText: JoJo Siwa wears a suit as she waves to someone.

props.synopsis: US singers Jojo Siwa and Cari Fletcher have caused a stir in the queer community. Here's why.

title.children: Why Fletcher and JoJo Siwa are causing controversy in the queer community

props.synopsis: This view inside some of the most precious and rare museum specimens on Earth is helping scientists to better understand the story of life — and it's all done without a scalpel in sight.

title.children: The CT scans that wiped millions off the value of a museum's collection

image.altText: first sat pic

props.synopsis: Satellite images show Iran's attack on a US military base in Qatar in June hit a dome housing equipment used for secure communications.

title.children: Pentagon confirms Iran's attack on Qatar air base hit dome used for US communications

image.altText: a damaged Qantas flight after it was rammed by an aerobridge at sydney international airport

props.synopsis: Qantas flight QF63 was due to depart from the international terminal when it made contact with the aerobridge during ground operations at its departing gate.

title.children: Passengers stranded after aerobridge hits plane at Sydney Airport

image.altText: A plate of pumpkin, lentil and coconut curry, topped with coconut cream and tadka. Slow cooker visible with more curry.

props.synopsis: Hearty lentils, creamy coconut, and the sweetness of pumpkin elevate this curry to a league of its own.

title.children: Come home to this slow-cooker curry with pumpkin, lentils and coconut
